pros: Amazing experience gaining compassion for the chronically street homeless
cons: horrible commute from brooklyn to manhattan

pros: Good Benefits and the boat ride
cons: Overwork employees and unexperienced upper management

pros: The people you work with depending on the team you’re on are pretty cool. That’s the only pro I think they have.
cons: Where to even start... upper management doesn’t care about you at all and behind your back they’re all throwing you under the bus with HPD. Keep all emails cause they’ll blame you for everything unless you can prove them wrong. So many conversations where I’ve heard the assistant director and directors saying to blame the staff for not doing the correct thing that they tell you to do and they Refuse to take responsibility for anything. Pay isn’t worth the work load, they start about 36k a year and only give between 1-3% raise with no bonuses. They’re don’t make it easy to want to stay. This is just a little bit compared to what it’s truly like working at this place.
advice_to_mgmt: Learn to take responsibility and don’t blame the staff for your mistakes.

pros: If this is you first experience working with street homeless people. If you have the right team it's a great learning experience.
cons: Management in my building show ALOT of favoritism.
advice_to_mgmt: Stop showing FAVORTISM!!

pros: Good if your passionate about the homeless population
cons: Pay Rate Stays THE same. No raise

pros: stay away from this company
cons: senior management is very poor and they cover for each other and hire family
advice_to_mgmt: stop cover up of your Administration

pros: Breaking ground is a great company that is doing a good job in placing former homeless veterans and regular civilians in permanent affordable housing this company is doing there part in trying to better people lives and they're well being as well
cons: The salaries can be a little better but it's a non profit so take it for what it is
advice_to_mgmt: Try to be more connected with residents to try and benefit them in improving there lives

pros: Helping people attain affordable housing in newly constructed luxury buildings
cons: With the merge of two roles sometimes the workload becomes difficult when adhering to deadlines
advice_to_mgmt: Pay rate doesn't fit the workload or expectations. Also starting salary should depend on experience although it states that in job postings experience isn't considered everyone in the same title starts at the same pay rate

pros: This is a great company
cons: Managers seem to favor certain people

pros:
Honest not much there - I was able to work early and leave early ( 8+ hours daily)
Team members were good and most were helpful - but honest most were older woman (i am male) these ladies were viscous to each other at times.
But all in all everyone helped each other.
cons:
Management was horrible on both floors 5th and 12th - FAVORITISM WAS OPEN AND RAMPANT- President or CEO of Company hires her Brother who worked in total different job before hand.. Honest - no communication at all between depts.
They wanted the work of 5 to be done by 3 people and did not care at all if you worked thru lunch into the nite. Mangers being hired with no knowledge of the position - the manager leaving would not even recommend the guy who was replacing him after trying to train the person for couple weeks. But was told he has friends up stairs. Very nasty people in charge of 5th floor nasty and rude and arrogant.
advice_to_mgmt: nothing that would be taken serious.

pros: The people (staff) are phenomenal. Very smart, dedicated and committed. The line staff and first tier of management work incredibly hard, but are not given the tools, resources nor leadership to be successful!
cons: Management. The Senior level management is unprepared and incompetent. This is highlighted by very high turnover, poor performance, nepotism and complete lack of diversity at the leadership level.
advice_to_mgmt: Commit to Performance, accountability and training. Trust staff and respect your clients; the applicants you are charged to serve

pros: great staff, flexible, able to learn
cons: it's a non-profit. there's some draw backs in terms of perks.

review_title: Great to work with the tenants, zero professional development
years_at_company: Great to work with the tenants, zero professional development
pros: Working with the tenants is great. Overall really nice facilities and compelling mission. Some of the people Rosanne hired are around and great.
cons: Zero training. Zero professional development. Grossly understaffed and very high expectations (which is great but also unrealistic). Extremely top down. Won't consider anything without running everything by every possible exec. No room for creativity.
advice_to_mgmt: Let people share ideas, feedback and perspectives freely. Stop punishing and blacklisting people for speaking up.

pros: Enjoyed working with all clients
cons: Unprofessional supervisorsthat belittle you due to your experience.

pros: A job where you help homeless people obtain housing.
cons: No job security. Job is subject to city funding.
advice_to_mgmt: Listen to your staff's concerns.

review_title: What Was Once A Good Idea Has Succumbed to The Almighty Dollar
years_at_company: What Was Once A Good Idea Has Succumbed to The Almighty Dollar
pros:
Helping homeless and at-risk people find permanent housing and services.
Nice colleagues--very motivated people.
cons:
High turn-over.
Cliquish upper management.
Staff is overworked and understaffed.
Expectations of staff to reach unreasonable goals kills enthusiasm.
Upper management quick to throw others under the bus to protect their positions.
Company has lost its vision to help at-risk and homeless people in order to concentrate on earning fees to manage other developers' projects.
Management believes its own hype.
advice_to_mgmt: Stop taking on multiple third-party development projects when you have no ability to meet the goals. Upper management "club" in the leasing department needs to take responsibility for failures and over promising--not blame others who do the daily grunt work.

pros:
Everyone, from housekeeping staff at the buildings to management, is focused on the mission
Kind and tenacious staff who get things done
Top of its field
cons: Growth has produced some strains on infrastructure

pros: Policy for pay time off is very flexible
cons:
New employees promoted to the supervisory roles, very inexperienced. Very unapproachable, one way communication style, biased. Need stronger training sections.

The work environment is very cold and uninviting for new employees, is it more of a doing it on your own training, which leads to insecure way of doing the work. Once you become an employee, supervisors will judge you based on how they performed when in your position. They will not understand that the employee need time to learn, and even more if doing the learning on its own. The employee have so much to learn, especially for an employee that is completely new to the Mental Health arena and have not experience working with mentally ill clients.
advice_to_mgmt: New Hires needs to more technical and practical training, before abandoning them on a do it yourself approach.

pros:
- Great benefits and health care.
- Friendly environment
- Focus on continual improvement of services and buildings
cons:
- Few opportunities for advancement (depends on department)
- Some friction between departments
advice_to_mgmt: Create opportunities for staff to grow and thrive

pros: The work we do is meaningful and mission driven, as a team we are able to accomplish great things for New Yorkers.
cons: The work we do can be daunting and can seem endless in the face of such need.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to improve communication across all staff as the organization grows.

pros: The agency has excellent health benefits
cons: The agency has a very public segregation internally. Blacks or treated totally differently then Caucasian staff. Blacks are not promoted within the agency. The Outreach team management team are all Caucasian people. The Senior Team does not consist of any People of color. The agency is a huge Trump Supportive and have donated money to Trump campaign

pros: Good benefits, including time off
cons: No room for growth within the said program or agency also staff who've been working over 2 yrs making almost the same salary as new employees
advice_to_mgmt: Just as you advertise during orientation of promotion within stick to your word be honest with new employees

pros: Great company that truly cares about the impact that they have. The difference you are making in the lives of your clients is not always felt on a day to day basis, but you are really helping to humanize people who are often treated like trash.
cons: The starting pay seems to be good for the industry, but it is still low for degree holder. The job and clients are difficult.

review_title: Does not do right by applicants
years_at_company: Does not do right by applicants
pros: Trying to help people on a daily basis
cons: I have witnessed them dragging along applicants for a year with promises of an apartment because no one knows what the other is doing with such a high turnover rate. I've seen someone screw up a file at the last minute and all of the documents that were submitted are not accounted for. I've even witnessed someone in senior management who had to take over when someone left accuse a client of fraud and take away their acceptance for an apartment when they had no idea what had been going on for a year with the other person who had been working on their file. I don't know how anyone gets through our system for an apartment who qualifies and deserves it.
advice_to_mgmt: Run a tighter ship. You can't afford high level mistakes at such a company that is supposed to be helping others.

pros: It was cool working to help people.
cons: Important work, but not important pay.
advice_to_mgmt: Pay people better.

pros: Not a good company they don't look out for they employees.
cons: They are not good to work for if your looking for a career.

review_title: High Staff Turnover For A Reason
years_at_company: High Staff Turnover For A Reason
pros: Core mission to provide supportive housing to homeless and at risk individuals is wonderful. Great co-workers. Some of the nicest people you will meet in a workplace
cons:
Salaries are not competitive even for non-profit. High turn-over. Cliquish upper management. Management does not appreciate entry level staffers who put in extra hours.
The organization has lost its vision to provide housing to at-risk people. It is more focused on doing Affordable rent-ups for luxury developers to earn fees, than moving people into apartments who need supportive housing. Company has taken on more third-party projects than they were ready for. The compliance and leasing teams are overwhelmed. People work 10 to 12 hours daily trying to reach goals that are unrealistic with the current staffing and organization. Management scape-goats others to save face. Don’t expect supervisors to have your back.
advice_to_mgmt: Listen to staff recommendations--they are in the trenches on a daily basis. Big annual company events do not make up for not acknowledging staff's hard work on the daily. People are willing to put in extra hours but people expecting a 9 to 5 position should not feel bad because they are not staying until 8pm.

pros: Good benefits and the ability to do a lot of good
cons: Clique-ish culture, poor supervision, (personally) discouraging doing outreach when I'm not working or on the clock, working with people who are not passionate about helping homeless individuals and who can be racist
advice_to_mgmt: Learn to be empathetic, do not discourage passion for homelessness, hire people who are invested in the work and not in the paycheck

pros: The mission of the organization is good and what they do to help homeless people.
cons: Very micro managed, the senior staff can be condescending and rude. They act like they have a problem when you decide to take a day off. Wouldn't recommend this place
advice_to_mgmt: Stop being micro manageable! You don't have to breathe down the necks of your employees all the time! Stop getting attitudes when we take off or go on a lunch break. Be better at managing

pros:
Good place to learn things around, lot of days off, lot of holidays, schedule is great.
Some very good co-workers, some not so much who are all about taking advantage of benefits at maximum possible level with calling out etc.
cons:
Very high cost of health care, and its getting worse each year.
Upper management decisions are questionable.
We became numbers on the paper for them.
HR is limited.
People are been blamed for smallest things and held responsible for them.
Tenants/clients are highest priority, which is a good thing, but not with complete disregard to employees.
Staff is limited

pros:
They seem to have a track record of promoting from within.
Good company culture that I've experienced thusfar. Work feels purposeful .
Colleagues are amazing.
cons:
The salary isn't the most competitive , it seems to trend on the lower end for most positions.
No Self Directed Options with retirement savings

review_title: Place of Privilege: Prejudice work environment
years_at_company: Place of Privilege: Prejudice work environment
pros:
The organization is a life line for many.

At Street to Home Manhattan if you are not a minority, just got out of college, have no idea what to do with your life and look down on homeless people or poor people, this organization is very willing to pay you to reinforce your beliefs.
cons:
The endemic prejudiced present in the organization out weighs tarnishes any good the organization can do.

22 year olds with no work experience are treated as more qualified than adults with experience, skills and willingness to work in the social services. Their right to treat the place like a stepping stone is valued more by management than providing services to clients.
advice_to_mgmt: Hire promote and fire based on merit not prejudice.

review_title: Worked as an Residential Aide for 3 yrs. 3 months 13 days
years_at_company: Worked as an Residential Aide for 3 yrs. 3 months 13 days
pros: Residents are great to work with, co worker like family case manager great. Never worked with a close tight of worker when the job needed to get done I got done... Upper management never realized the supporting group they had
cons: Too many coworkers got fired when a write up would solve the problems. Always worker had to follow instructions when we knew thee would be other ways to get the job done
advice_to_mgmt: They need to comply with FDNY and DHS fire drills and exterminator needs to come to facilities more than twice a week.

pros: Nonprofit, helps people in the community, small company, generous time off
cons: low salaries, high benefits costs, low opportunity for advancement

pros: Some of the best reasons to work at Common Ground are the excellent coworkers and the mission.
cons: The downside of working at Common Ground is the low salary for entry level positions.

pros: Getting people off the streets
cons: Management is horrible, HR is no better.
advice_to_mgmt: Work on HR best practices and Management

review_title: Management got better after I left the job
years_at_company: Management got better after I left the job
pros: I loved working with the homeless men population. Most of them are very appreciative of the case management services I provided to them in assistance getting them housing.
cons: Staff is somewhat lazy and doesn't want to do more work than the next person. The clients get away with doing a lot of unacceptable things with no repercussions. Many clients enter the shelter program with drug issues and mental health problems, that need to be worked on and address prior to providing the client with housing. Common Ground is only concerned with getting them house so they can benefit off of the money they receive for each placement. In most cases clients become homeless again in less than a year.
advice_to_mgmt: I heard management has gotten better since I left there.

pros: "In-the-trenches" staff are all committed to Common Ground's cause and are wonderful to work with.
cons: Management does not care about the staff. They give the public the impression that the organization is very caring, but it is only towards the client, not the staff.
advice_to_mgmt: Pay attention to your staff - without them there is no Common Ground

pros: Chance to positively change lives
cons: Everyone is based on short-term outcomes, and not if solutions will last. You end up pushing paper and see the same people years later back in similar situations. Many employees are just going through the motions and no longer work to serve the mission or the organization. Less-than-stellar managers.

pros: All hands on deck. A great place to work if you like the multicultural environment
cons: They can do a better job paying junior leadership
advice_to_mgmt: Listen to your junior team more! After all, they're carrying out the day to day responsibilities

pros: Good place to start, many different areas to work in, good work life balance, flexibility
cons: small, limited growth potential, lacks retirement benefits
advice_to_mgmt: none

review_title: Great place to work for. Too much socializing among employees.
years_at_company: Great place to work for. Too much socializing among employees.
pros: My internship at this company led to full time employment. This is a great company to work for with room for advancement. However, co workers are not very helpful to newcomers. Working environment is great.
cons: I feel management have too many rules that are not followed but can be used to terminate your employment. There is too much socializing among employees. Management turns a blind eye to the office romances, which in turn can create distrust and impartial treatment among employees. The drinking after work and being non productive the next day is a routine.
advice_to_mgmt: Rules should be enforced at all times and not only when problems arise. Strict drug testing needs to be enforced. The debauchery and workplace romances needs to be addressed.

pros: You get to help and meet new people. The staff is always very nice and helpful.they seem to really care about there job.
cons: I can't really think of any cons this place is pretty much well rounded and only out to do goods for people in need.
advice_to_mgmt: Advice to management keep up the good work. Its great that people are giving back to the community helping others.its great

pros: The hrs. and scheduling is flexible
cons: Pay is too low for someone to adequately live in NYC
advice_to_mgmt: Give more opportunities for growth and promote schooling, pay for studies.

pros:
Great, caring people to work with
Wonderful cause
Lots of days off
cons: Management does not care about employees
advice_to_mgmt: Respect your employed as much as you respect the clients

review_title: With the training I achieved and my own personial experience I was able to go in the streets and work and learn and like
years_at_company: With the training I achieved and my own personial experience I was able to go in the streets and work and learn and like
pros: My co workers, They took time out and gave me good advice.That made the job much easer.
cons: The walking and the weather, Ihad to turn that into positive.
advice_to_mgmt: Need more time in the office to do documentation, I understand THE IMPORTANCE OF field work, but it needs to be documented, and not backed up.

review_title: Great work culture but lots of turnover.
years_at_company: Great work culture but lots of turnover.
pros: Common Ground has a fantastic office culture. The staff community is extremely friendly and motivated and they are very committed to the mission of the organization. The company values a good work and personal life balance and does not expect the general salaried staff to work extra hours.
cons: There are very limited opportunities for growth within the company. Additionally, the salaries for non-management staff are low and not sustainable long term for living in New York City. The combination of these two factors ultimately causes a lot of turn over in the company.

pros: Relaxed environment. Great coworkers. Meaningful job.
cons: The salary could be better.

review_title: Good company with a good mission
years_at_company: Good company with a good mission
pros: A good company to work for with a good mission. Good people to work with
cons: Finance department is disorganized because of the current CFO. The employees that work hard are not appreciated while the one who know how to play the politics game are rewarded.
advice_to_mgmt: no advice to management because they are the problem.

review_title: Good organization doing good work for New York City
years_at_company: Good organization doing good work for New York City
pros: Common ground is a great, mission-driven organization focused on building and managing permanent supportive housing for New York City's homeless populations. The organization has many different types of job opportunities from building maintenance and management to architects and designers to fundraising and development staff.
cons: Common Ground can be a bit bureaucratic as it has grown into a large organization, but it does great work to house the homeless and provided much needed support services so that they stay housed.

pros: Lots of flexibility and trust within the program. We were given our tasks for the day and the vehicle then pretty much left alone until we reported back to the office.
cons: Disorganization and slow housing process. There were many situations where the more deserving clients did not receive housing because of politics
advice_to_mgmt: Provide more clarity to employees about expectations.

pros: It is my dream career.
cons: Long hours, self run, I do all my own scheduling
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up!
